children.description: I'm sorry, but I couldn't find the coordinates for the domain name www.zyw.com.

Based on the previous actions, it seems that there are no valid coordinates available for the given IP address. To try a different approach, I can use the "search_location_by_ip_address" function to get the location of the IP address associated with the domain name.

compare_candidates.description: Based on the previous actions, it seems that there are no valid coordinates available for the given IP address. To try a different approach, I can use the "search_location_by_ip_address" function to get the location of the IP address associated with the domain name.

function.name: get_ip_by_domain_name_for_search_ip_by_domain_name
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "search_ip_by_domain_name", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Query the corresponding IP according to the domain name provided by the user"

domain_name.description: Domain name to query IP Address, e.g. www.zyw.com

function.name: get_coordinates_by_location_for_search_coordinates_by_location
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "search_coordinates_by_location", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Query the corresponding latitude and longitude based on the user-provided location."

location.description: Location to query latitude and longitude, e.g. Nanjing

function.name: search_telnum_location_for_telnum_location
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "telnum_location", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Query the location according to the user-provided telnum."

function.name: get_location_by_ip_address_for_search_location_by_ip_address
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "search_location_by_ip_address", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "To get location with user-provided IP Address"

ip_address.description: Query the corresponding location according to the IP address provided by the user, e.g. 10.0.106.333

function.name: get_pm25_forecast_for_pm25_forecast
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "pm25_forecast", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Query PM2.5 forecasts based on user-supplied locations"

location.description: location to get pm2.5, e.g. Nanjing

function.name: get_weather_forecast_for_weather_forecast
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "weather_forecast", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "To get the weather forecast with user-provided location"

location.description: The location toget the weather forecast, e.g. Nanjing

function.name: Finish
function.description: If you believe that you have obtained a result that can answer the task, please call this function to provide the final answer. Alternatively, if you recognize that you are unable to proceed with the task in the current state, call this function to restart. Remember: you must ALWAYS call this function at the end of your attempt, and the only part that will be shown to the user is the final answer, so it should contain sufficient information.

final_answer.description: The final answer you want to give the user. You should have this field if "return_type"=="give_answer"

train_messages.content:
You are AutoGPT, you can use many tools(functions) to do the following task.
First I will give you the task description, and your task start.
At each step, you need to give your thought to analyze the status now and what to do next, with a function call to actually excute your step.
After the call, you will get the call result, and you are now in a new state.
Then you will analyze your status now, then decide what to do next...
After many (Thought-call) pairs, you finally perform the task, then you can give your finial answer.
Remember: 
1.the state change is irreversible, you can't go back to one of the former state, if you want to restart the task, say "I give up and restart".
2.All the thought is short, at most in 5 sentence.
3.You can do more then one trys, so if your plan is to continusly try some conditions, you can do one of the conditions per try.
Let's Begin!
Task description: You should use functions to help handle the real time user querys. Remember:
1.ALWAYS call "Finish" function at the end of the task. And the final answer should contain enough information to show to the user,If you can't handle the task, or you find that function calls always fail(the function is not valid now), use function Finish->give_up_and_restart.
2.Do not use origin tool names, use only subfunctions' names.
You have access of the following tools:
1.search_ip_by_domain_name: To get IP address by domain name
2.search_coordinates_by_location: To get longitude and latitude by location
3.telnum_location: To get the location of the telnum
4.search_location_by_ip_address: To get location by IP address
5.pm25_forecast: To get PM2.5 Forecasts
6.weather_forecast: weather forecast
